Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Summaries: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties, exploring themes of love, wealth, and the American Dream through the story of Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

Title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
Author: J.K. Rowling
Summaries: The first book in the Harry Potter series, a fantasy story about a young orphan boy who discovers he is a wizard and attends a school of magic.

Title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Author: Douglas Adams
Summaries: A comedic science fiction novel following the adventures of an unwitting human and his alien friend as they travel through space and time.

Title: The Da Vinci Code
Author: Dan Brown
Summaries: A thriller novel centered around a symbologist and a cryptologist who follow clues to unravel a conspiracy involving the Catholic Church and the Holy Grail.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
Summaries: A classic novel of manners set in 19th-century England, exploring the relationships and social customs of the wealthy Bennet family.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Author: Harper Lee
Summaries: A classic novel set in the 1930s South, exploring themes of racism, prejudice, and social inequality through the eyes of a young girl named Scout Finch.

Author: George Orwell
Summaries: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where individualism is suppressed and the government controls every aspect of citizens' lives.

Title: The Lord of the Rings
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Summaries: A fantasy epic following hobbit Frodo Baggins and his companions as they journey to destroy the One Ring and defeat the evil Sauron.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J.D. Salinger
Summaries: A novel following the misadventures of Holden Caulfield, a teenage boy who is disillusioned with the adult world.

Title: To the Lighthouse
Author: Virginia Woolf
Summaries: A novel exploring the inner lives of a family as they vacation on the Isle of Skye, Scotland.

Title: The Shining
Author: Stephen King
Summaries: A horror novel about a family who becomes trapped in a haunted hotel during the winter.

Title: The Hunger Games
Author: Suzanne Collins
Summaries: A dystopian novel set in a post-apocalyptic world where teenagers are forced to fight to the death in an annual televised event.

Title: The Alchemist
Author: Paulo Coelho
Summaries: A novel following a shepherd boy who embarks on a journey to find a treasure and discovers the importance of following one's dreams.

Title: Little Women
Author: Louisa May Alcott
Summaries: A classic novel following the lives of four sisters as they grow up and navigate the challenges of womanhood during the American Civil War.

Title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
Author: Stieg Larsson
Summaries: A thriller novel following a journalist and a computer hacker as they investigate a decades-old disappearance and uncover a web of corruption and violence.

Title: Animal Farm
Author: George Orwell
Summaries: A political allegory in which a group of farm animals rebel against their human farmer and establish their own government, which becomes corrupt and oppressive.

Title: The Diary of a Young Girl
Author: Anne Frank
Summaries: A memoir in which a Jewish girl documents her experiences hiding with her family during the Nazi occupation of the Netherlands.

Title: Frankenstein
Author: Mary Shelley
Summaries: A Gothic novel about a scientist who creates a living being from human parts and is horrified by the monster he has made.

Title: Wuthering Heights
Author: Emily Bronte
Summaries: A Gothic novel set in the moors of England, following the tumultuous relationship between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

Title: Great Expectations
Author: Charles Dickens
Summaries: A coming-of-age novel following the life of an orphan boy named Pip and his journey to becoming a gentleman.

Title: The Girl on the Train
Author: Paula Hawkins
Summaries: A psychological thriller about a woman who becomes embroiled in a missing persons investigation after witnessing something from her train window.

Title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle
Summaries: A collection of short stories featuring the famous detective Sherlock Holmes and his partner Dr. Watson solving crimes in Victorian London.

Title: War and Peace
Author: Leo Tolstoy
Summaries: An epic novel by Leo Tolstoy that follows the lives of several aristocratic families during the Napoleonic Wars.

Title: The Bell Jar
Author: Sylvia Plath
Summaries: A semi-autobiographical novel by Sylvia Plath about a young woman's descent into mental illness.

Title: Gone Girl
Author: Gillian Flynn
Summaries: A psychological thriller about a man whose wife disappears and he becomes the prime suspect in her disappearance.

Title: Les Miserables
Author: Victor Hugo
Summaries: A novel by Victor Hugo that follows the lives of several characters in 19th century France, including an ex-convict and a police inspector.

Title: The Outsiders
Author: S.E. Hinton
Summaries: A coming-of-age novel by S.E. Hinton about a group of working-class teenagers in Oklahoma.

Title: The Road
Author: Cormac McCarthy
Summaries: A post-apocalyptic novel by Cormac McCarthy about a father and son's journey through a barren and dangerous landscape.

Title: Crime and Punishment
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
Summaries: A novel by Fyodor Dostoevsky that follows a young man who commits a murder and struggles with guilt and redemption.

Title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
Author: Oscar Wilde
Summaries: A novel by Oscar Wilde about a man who remains young and beautiful while a portrait of him ages and shows the physical toll of his hedonistic lifestyle.

Title: The Hobbit
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Summaries: A fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien about a hobbit who embarks on an adventure with dwarves to reclaim their treasure from a dragon.

Title: Jane Eyre
Author: Charlotte Bronte
Summaries: A novel by Charlotte Bronte about a young woman who becomes a governess and falls in love with her employer, Mr. Rochester.

Title: The Brothers Karamazov
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
Summaries: A novel by Fyodor Dostoevsky about a dysfunctional family and the murder of the father, with themes of religion, philosophy, and morality.

Title: The Count of Monte Cristo
Author: Alexandre Dumas
Summaries: A novel by Alexandre Dumas about a man who is wrongfully imprisoned and seeks revenge on those who betrayed him after he escapes and becomes wealthy.

Title: Dracula
Author: Bram Stoker
Summaries: A Gothic horror novel by Bram Stoker about a vampire who terrorizes Victorian England.

Title: The Grapes of Wrath
Author: John Steinbeck
Summaries: A novel by John Steinbeck about a family's journey from Oklahoma to California during the Great Depression.

Title: Beloved
Author: Toni Morrison
Summaries: A novel by Toni Morrison about a former slave who is haunted by the ghost of her baby daughter.

Title: The Color Purple
Author: Alice Walker
Summaries: A novel by Alice Walker about a young black woman in rural Georgia who overcomes abuse and oppression to find her own voice and independence.

Title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
Author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
Summaries: A novel by Gabriel Garcia Marquez that tells the story of the Buendia family over several generations in the fictional town of Macondo.

Title: The Handmaid's Tale
Author: Margaret Atwood
Summaries: A dystopian novel by Margaret Atwood about a woman living in a future where the government has established a totalitarian regime based on a strict interpretation of the Bible.

Title: The Kite Runner
Author: Khaled Hosseini
Summaries: A novel by Khaled Hosseini about a boy growing up in Afghanistan and his friendship with the son of his father's servant, set against the backdrop of the Soviet invasion and later Taliban rule.

Title: A Game of Thrones
Author: George R.R. Martin
Summaries: The first book in the "A Song of Ice and Fire" series by George R.R. Martin, a fantasy epic set in a medieval-like world with political intrigue, war, and supernatural elements.

Title: Brave New World
Author: Aldous Huxley
Summaries: A dystopian novel by Aldous Huxley about a future society where people are conditioned from birth to conform to a rigid social hierarchy and where pleasure and consumption are valued above all else.

Title: Anna Karenina
Author: Leo Tolstoy
Summaries: a novel about the tragic love affair between Anna, a married aristocrat, and Count Vronsky, a wealthy military man. The novel explores themes of love, adultery, family, and society in 19th century Russia.

Title: The Sun Also Rises
Author: Ernest Hemingway
Summaries: a novel that follows a group of American and British expatriates as they travel from Paris to Pamplona, Spain, to watch the running of the bulls and participate in the bullfights. The novel explores themes of disillusionment, masculinity, and the Lost Generation.

Title: The Old Man and the Sea
Author: Ernest Hemingway
Summaries: a short novel about an aging fisherman named Santiago who sets out on a fishing expedition in the Gulf Stream and catches a giant marlin. The novel explores themes of determination, endurance, and the human struggle against nature.
